REE3614 - Environmental Issues for Real.name: REE3614 - Environmental Issues for Real Estate

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: REE 3043, REE 3433; open to majors or minors which require this course.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Political, cultural, institutional and scientific mechanisms which shape environmental policy. The effects of hazard, risk and uncertainty in policy development.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Application of basic tools of economics, finance, and marketing to solve private and public sector real estate problems.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Focus on real estate decision-making in the private sector utilizing tools of financial and economic analysis.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An analysis of real estate law with emphasis on Florida statutes and case law.

REE4933 - Advanced Topics in Real Estate.name: REE4933 - Advanced Topics in Real Estate

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: REE 3043 and REE 3433, or department approval.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Advanced topics in real estate development, investment analysis, and market analysis. Cases cover the entire planning process for a real estate development or redevelopment project.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: FIN 3403; open to majors or minors which require this course.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of the practice of residential real estate finance; emphasis on lender and borrower decision making and secondary markets.

REE4103 - Real Estate Appraisal and Valu.name: REE4103 - Real Estate Appraisal and Valuation

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Focus on the fundamentals of real estate valuation utilizing tools of financial and economic analysis.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: FIN 3403; open to majors or minors which require this course.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The practice of commercial real estate finance; emphasis on lender and borrower decision making and secondary markets.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Course applies finance and economic tools to housing and commercial markets, emphasis on urban housing, real estate brokerage, effects on market performance and development.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The real estate development process, from the inception of a project through to lease-up, long-term financing, and final sale to the investment community.
